item.title: As Israel ramps up strikes in Gaza, civilians have nowhere left to go
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Hajar Harb, Hazem Balousha
item.description: Palestinians and humanitarian workers have said the wave of recent attacks are similar in intensity and lethality to those in the early weeks of the war.

item.title: Houthis claim deadly drone strike near U.S. Embassy office in Tel Aviv
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin, Kareem Fahim, Kelsey Ables
item.description: One person was killed and seven injured in the attack, which took place hours after the Israeli air force killed two Hezbollah commanders in Lebanon.

item.title: The Trump-Vance ticket aligns the GOP with Europe’s far right
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: Trump’s GOP is participating in the same conversation taking place in many countries in Europe.

item.title: ‘I Divorce You’: Dubai princess’s Instagram declaration defies custom
item.dc:creator: Anika Seth
item.description: “I divorce you, I divorce you, and I Divorce You,” wrote Sheikha Mahra, invoking the practice of triple talaq, which allows a Muslim man to divorce his wife by saying the Arabic word for divorce three times.

item.title: New U.K. prime minister seeks reset with Europe after years of squabbling
item.dc:creator: William Booth, Emily Rauhala, Karla Adam
item.description: Keir Starmer has said Britain won’t be rejoining the E.U. But he used a summit at Blenheim Palace to begin patching things up with European leaders.

item.title: The Persian Gulf is enduring life-threatening heat indexes above 140 degrees
item.dc:creator: Dan Stillman
item.description: Water temperatures have reached 95 degrees.

item.title: Tense election raises concerns of new Venezuelan exodus to U.S.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Schmidt, Nick Miroff
item.description: About a quarter of the population has already fled Nicolás Maduro’s rule. Of those who remain, 1 in 3 say they’ll consider leaving if he is not defeated.

item.title: Israeli right-wing minister visits Temple Mount, showcasing influence
item.dc:creator: Steve Hendrix, Leo Sands, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: Itamar Ben Gvir’s visit to the al-Aqsa Mosque compound came one day after an Israeli delegation landed in Cairo to resume negotiations with Hamas through mediators.

item.title: The most unlikely city on Taylor Swift’s Europe tour: Gelsenkirchen
item.dc:creator: Kate Brady
item.description: This long down-on-its-luck German city is so pleased with its momentary good fortune that it has temporarily declared itself “Swiftkirchen.”

item.title: Smoke plumes may reach U.S. as wildfires in Canada erupt
item.dc:creator: Ian Livingston
item.description: One of the biggest eruptions of thick smoke from Canada’s wildfires is beginning to drift south, with the Midwest, Great Lakes and eventually Northeast potentially in its path.

item.title: Russian court moves quickly in trial of journalist Evan Gershkovich
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: Meanwhile, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov confirmed talks for a potential exchange deal for the Wall Street Journal reporter.

item.title: Listeria linked to nondairy products kills 2, sickens 10 in Canada
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Hassan
item.description: Health Canada recalled 18 plant-based milk products by Silk and Great Value. Danone, which owns Silk, says the 15 recalled products are not distributed outside Canada.

item.title: Citing poor health, Vietnam leader Nguyen Phu Trong steps back from duties
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan
item.description: Trong presided over a period of greater economic openness and a domestic political crackdown as Vietnam became a swing state in Asia’s great power games.

item.title: Iran denies plot against Trump, after U.S. reports unspecified threat
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih
item.description: U.S. intelligence officials have warned that Iran may seek to avenge the 2020 assassination of Iranian commander Qasem Soleimani, which was authorized by Trump.

item.title: As a trafficker pursued dreams of soccer glory, investigators closed in
item.dc:creator: Kevin Sieff
item.description: Sebastian Marset bounced from team to team as he indulged his soccer fantasy, sold tons of cocaine and tried to stay ahead of the law.

item.title: A double life: The cocaine kingpin who hid as a professional soccer player
item.dc:creator: Kevin Sieff
item.description: A trafficker in Latin America used his wealth to buy professional soccer teams and then fulfilled a boyhood dream: He inserted himself into the starting lineups.

item.title: Hezbollah leader threatens new attacks on Israeli towns as tensions rise
item.dc:creator: Suzan Haidamous, Maham Javaid
item.description: Hezbollah leader Hasan Nasrallah struck a victorious tone in a speech, claiming Israel has been exhausted by the fighting in Gaza and external pressures.

item.title: Pentagon ends troubled Gaza pier mission, shifts focus to Israeli port
item.dc:creator: Alex Horton, Dan Lamothe
item.description: The Gaza pier operation directed by President Biden enabled the delivery of millions of pounds of food but faced near-constant complications.

item.title: China suspends nuclear talks with the U.S. over Taiwan arms sales
item.dc:creator: Cate Cadell, Abigail Hauslohner
item.description: The Chinese announcement comes as U.S. policy on Taiwan hangs in the balance ahead of the November election.

item.title: King’s Speech and parliamentary pomp mark major power shift in U.K.
item.dc:creator: William Booth, Karla Adam
item.description: During the State Opening of Parliament, King Charles wore a heavy crown, and the theatrics of the constitutional monarchy were on full display.

item.title: Paris mayor swims in the Seine, declares it clean for the Olympics
item.dc:creator: Rick Noack
item.description: “It’s pure happiness,” Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo said, having fulfilled her pledge to clean up the Seine before the Games. Now officials hope it stays that way.

item.title: Cyanide, found in cups, probably killed 6 in Bangkok hotel room, officials say
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Wilawan Watcharasakwej
item.description: Officials suspect the two Americans and four Vietnamese died of poisoning at the Grand Hyatt Erawan Bangkok and may have been involved in a business dispute.

item.title: Wall Street Journal fires Hong Kong reporter who headed embattled press club
item.dc:creator: Shibani Mahtani
item.description: The Hong Kong Journalists Association has been accused in recent weeks by state-run media outlets in Hong Kong and China of destabilizing the city.

item.title: As mobilization rules kick in, some Ukrainian men pay to flee, dodging draft
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Khurshudyan, Kostiantyn Khudov
item.description: Some Ukrainian men are paying thousands of dollars to dodge the draft by hiring smugglers to escape the country as key provisions of a mobilization law take hold.
